Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Byron G
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay while on visit to Istanbul. Perfect service, professiona and kind and incredibely informative. Perfect location, walking distance from most available sites. In the heart of it all! I was exspecially happy about the fact that requested outside takeaway ordering was available for just inside my hotel room when needed. And the minibar was excellent in its mulitple choices at offer as well as the walk out balcony was a plus for any attraction worth viewing from my street overlooking room.

Reviews.Title: “It was just Awesome !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Khringo
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Istanbul. And i was realy suprised by the beauty of the city and also the country. i came here with 3 friends and we were welcomed by the team "CEHANE", "Luqman" and "Nedim". They are very helpful and nice. the rooms are well arranged and clean. The hotel is clean and the breakfast on the terrace is very delicious, prepared by the way by LUQMAN's Wife. The hotel is located in the center of Sultanahmet, 2 minutes far from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia and 5 minutes from Topkapi Palace. Basically, I had a dream week and I'm very satisfied and enjoyed by my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, very friendly receptionists”
Reviews.Author: FAYSAL A
Reviews.Content: we stayed one week, nice experience, the receptionists helped us a lot especially Ceyhan, Luqman and Nedim. Very good Breakfest the hotel is located only two minutes from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia in the Sultanahmet district

Reviews.Title: “wow amzing i m very enjoy in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mehwish l
Reviews.Content: hotel apex i very enjoy apex hotel staff is very good service Excellent. Ä°n morning roof was so nice with sea veiw and blue mouqse evry think was great and aur room was so perty ,, if i come again in istanbul i will stay in apex hotel............,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: killemom
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few days in this hotel in October. It was a very pleasant stay, everything was perfect. Its a very small and cosy hotel, and since the weather was really bad in Istanbul during my stay, I spend some time at the hotel. I was participating at a friends wedding, so I had plenty of time on my own. The boys in the reception and the ladies who cleaned was so nice, helpful and friendly. The cleaning lady( I am so sorry I never asked her name) even came with food to my room as a nice surprise! Tea was free, and I got refilling on teabags many times The location is also perfect. Just 5 minutes walk from Aya Sofia and the blue mosque and many good restaurants just around the corner. Breakfast was served on a nice roof terrace overlooking the Marmara sea. The beds was not to hard, just perfect. Internet and heating worked, it was clean and spotless. Thanks for a very nice stay in rainy Istanbul :-)

Reviews.Title: “professional staff, clean hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine B
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from reception staff, who telephoned me when our coach was running 3 hours late, aid not to worry that the rooms were ready and waiting. Arrived at 3.30am, exhausted to be greeted by lovely staff member who checked us in quickly provided us with basic information i.e. map and breakfast times and showed us to our clean rooms. Wonderful location, nice roof terrace for breakfast with good choice of cheese / olives / cereals (what more do you need?) and plentyful hot coffee.

Reviews.Title: “True valued for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minaseyahi2011
Reviews.Content: Just ignore all bad comments, if you come to travel around Istanbul and not expect to stay in hotel much....this hotel is a must choice!!!! Room is fine, some problem with AC but still a good sleep. Breakfast also fine....but the most impressive thing is Staff which really generous and helpful.... Stay this hotel if you are real traveller!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: freecycle3
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel through expedia, I read some of the reviews here on trip advisor. I ignored the people who had had bad experiences with this hotel, assuming it wouldn't happen to me. Unfortunately, it did: I paid for a room at the Apex but was placed further down the hill at their affiliate, Sultan's Eyes. My single room was very small, had bad hot water, and had the constant company of ants (first discovered crawling out of my computer (!), which I had left in my locked suitcase on the floor (no opened food in it)), then making their way up my legs as I sat on the bed. Don't believe the hype--find another place, there are plenty nearby.

Reviews.Title: “not a place go back to”
Reviews.Author: JohnSibi
Reviews.Content: Reading the previous review it seams that what happened to us is a practice. We booked a room at Villa Pasha, a 4 star hotel and finally ended up in Apex Hotel because Villa Pasha done overbooking. after arguing with the manager from Apex that we paid for something differed he promised that if next days will be available rooms at Villa Pasha he will let us know. He didn't return to us next day and just avoid us.The furniture in our room was very outdated and actually the room is all beds. The bathroom is in very poor conditions and for closing the door at the room you need some exercise. The only plus is the staff at the reception that was very friendly and helpful, good English and nice attitude.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: peter_sindar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a quite street very close to agia sofia and the blue mosque. The employees at the reception were exceptionally polite and they could speak english rather fluently. The manager of the hotel was also very helpful when we asked him to make a reservation change. The room was cosy and was being cleaned every morning. The breakfast is served on a balcony on the top floor with great view. I would suggest this hotel with no second thought!

Reviews.Title: “Beware!! Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: krashtest
Reviews.Content: So you know how you sometimes you read that lone trip advisor review that's horrible and you're like "that sucks, but what are the chances that will happen to me?" Well, apparently they are pretty good!! Another reviewer wrote about a bait and switch about 1 month ago, and I read it, and still booked because of all the other positive reviews. However, when I arrived to check in, the couple ahead of me was having trouble. They had booked at APEX, but there was no room for them, so they would have to stay 100 meters away at the "sister" hotel. Off they went. So now I go to check in, same situation!! how many rooms are they going to overbook? and I was staying more than one night! So i'm laid back, I go with the flow, go to check out this other hotel. It's called the Moonlight, and it's not the same quality. As the other reviewer said, that hotel is ranked about 100 below this one. The rooms they showed me were 2 star hotel rooms. Don't get me wrong, I'll stay in a 1 star hotel if I want, but I will pay one star prices for it. And the service at Moonlight was very good, they were friendly and helpful. The room was basic, clean, etc. The low rating I am giving here is not for the Moonlight hotel, it's for the trickery of the Apex hotel. Now, does the Apex deserve a better rating than just that one lonely bubble thing i gave them? who knows, cuz I didn't get to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Stingy management”
Reviews.Author: gonebutnotdeparted
Reviews.Content: Good: Location is good being very near many of the most desirable attractions and the price is lower than some surrounding hotels. Bad: stingy beyond belief. It became a joke between my wife and me saying: "sure we have "x" ....- but you can't use it!". There are fan/AC units but they removed the remotes because "it is not hot enough for ac yet". There are shower jet panels but the valve handles have been removed. There is a glass cabinet proudly displaying the yogurt, milk, etc that you would like to enjoy for breakfast at the rooftop but it is locked. The server hardly ever gets around to setting these things out and if you ask you can be sure to never have them. Maintenance was lacking also. The shower hose and nozzle were broken so that you could not secure it anywhere and the curtains would not cover the window because of missing hangers or whatever. Overall I got the impression that they would not and have not spent a dime on this place for years. There were other significant problems including losing my reservation but I only have so much time. Also annoying and indicative of level of class here: the manager was outside in the street from 1 to 2 am pacing up and down and talking loudly on his cell phone and disturbing his guests. I would never go back to this place, ever. There are far superior places just across the street

Reviews.Title: “What a Sweet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holly1000-11
Reviews.Content: Friendly & helpful staff. Comfy bed. Quiet street at night, yet centrally located. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch? No, more like Sell and then switch”
Reviews.Author: LondonGenie
Reviews.Content: I feel aggrieved at what this hotel just did to us. We went to Istanbul for the Easter weekend and when we arrived with our printed out direct confirmation from the hotel itself were told that there was no room for us. What are people meant to do in such circumstances, wonder off and try and find another place on a rack-rate at 5pm? We were told that we would be put up at an associated hotel 100 metres away, and upgraded from a standard double to a suite. But the place we ended up is ranked something like 150th in Istanbul, versus 50th for the Apex. Plus we had the rigmarole of re-checking in with reception who could not seem to grasp that we were referred at our booked rate and not simply walk-in customers on the rack-rate. Then the 'suite' well it was their best room, but it wasn't a suite rather a small bedroom with a bathroom, and that at euro120 odd a night. Bait and Switch is at best fraudulent in many jurisdictions. Here we turned up confirmed at the Apex, but with no realistic choice but to accept something graded much lower. I'd suggest the Apex stop doing this immediately, and if they are that concerned about no-shows then take the first day of the room cost as a deposit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Friendly Staff, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: yalil
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the apex 4 nights at my 4th visit to the most beautiful city in the world. We were 2 women traveling, we never felt unsafe at the hotel, Lockman, Yacob and Yassin took care of us and helped us. Our room was perfect, the location was great and the price was very affordable. I will go back to the apex next year during my 5th visit to Istanbul. I loved the hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kate_dreamer
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in this hotel and I was extremely happy and satisfied with everything. Service is excellent, everybody is willing to do the extra mile to make your stay comfortable. They are really like a family and the hotel is like staying at home - with a lovely balcony used for breakfast. Breakfast is really good, good variety and the view is second to none. Perfect beginning of your day! My room was spacious, clean, comfortable, quite with all the necessary amenities. Great tea selection! Location is perfect, few minutes walking distance from the most popular hisotrical buildings in Sultanhamet, from the seaside, etc. I will be back to Istanbul and I would not stay anywhere else. Thank you, all of you, who looked after me during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great recommendation from Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: uskuhlmans
Reviews.Content: As usual, I used the recommendations of others to choose the APEX. I was not disappointed. As many have noted, the location was superb--a short walk to almost everything and with a fine assortment of shops and restaurants nearby. The neighborhood is full of small hotels and suspect that many of them would be fine choices. The internet worked flawlessly and the are was amazingly quite. Though it was very cold, the window was open all the time and the room was comfortable. Even with the widow open, there was little noise--with the exception of the 0530 call to prayer! The staff was friendly and accommodating and the breakfast was adequate--though the rooftop terrace was a real treat as the views were lovely. All in all, excellent value for money and a treat all around.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in old city”
Reviews.Author: dengregor
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel by a online agent. it is in the old city of Istanbul with nice rooms. The staff is also friendly and welcoming. Especially very handy to tram station. good value for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_hoppy
Reviews.Content: I have been remiss for not writing this review sooner. My mother 75yrs and myself stayed at this hotel for two nights before we headed to the shipping docks to board a cruise liner. Our experience of this hotel was 1. very close to the tram statÄ±on. 2. very close to tourist attractions like the Blue Mosque and Cistern. 3. Our room was nÄ±ce and clean. Although we were there in the winter we still had our breakfast outside on the upstairs deck, by the way breakfast was delÄ±cÄ±ous. 4. The staff were great from my online booking with numerous emails through to carrying our bags to and from our rooms. I also received a Blue Mosque statue which has pride of place among my many travel treasures. 5. I would not hesitate in returning.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE APEX HOTEL !”
Reviews.Author: Marwa_C
Reviews.Content: Apex hotel is really lovely the staff is friendly , the rooms are comfortable , clean and really beautiful !! it's because of this hotel that i enjoyed my holiday at Istanbul for the very first time!! wish all the best to all the staff over there !! i will always go there every time i go to Istanbul , Love you apex hotel !! <3

Reviews.Title: “I don't recommend!! We didn't get a room!!”
Reviews.Author: dialam123
Reviews.Content: The hotel didn't have a room for us although we have received 2 emails from the hotel confirming the reservation. We have also advised that we might arrive late and they said there is no problem with 24hr check in. Upon arrival we find out there is no room for us. The guy was hardly speaking English adnd we don't speak Turkish so we couldn't even explain what has happened and why they don't have a room. We were moved to other hotel, which I would never choose (because of the hotels reviews, I remembered it from the website) but it was 1 am and we were exhausted after 3 hours delay of our flight so we stayed there. We were given 3 bed room and we were told we can stay there for 3 nights. The next day they told us to change the room cause we paid for double-bed not 3- bed room. Fair enough but why previous night they told us we will stay in that room?? Overall - I don't recommend Apex Boutique Hotel. We were talking to a manager on the phone and he didn't see any problems in the fact that we stayed in a completely different hotel that we wanted and we paid for. We said we should received a discount because the hotel we stayed in had a lower standard but he said he would give us a discount if we have stayed 2 nights instead of 3. LOL

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: inmorocconow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in December 2010. This is a nice little hotel, within 10 min walk of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. A bit hard to find at first, but once you find it the location is great. Had a lovely stay for my last night in Istanbul! Amazing little rooms with heat and a good clean bathroom. Terrific to have internet in the room! Just a few little FYIs for future travelers looking up this hotel on Tripadvisor that are no means criticism of the hotel and absolutely have not been considered in my review : The rooftop terrace, where breakfast is served, can be a bit chilly in the winter as the plastic sheeting that serves to help keep out the elements does not keep out the cold. You may want to bring your coat the first day you are there if traveling in the winter until you determine whether or not it's an issue. If you are looking to book the budget double room, do be aware that at least one of them is on the ground floor near the stairs/computer where you get noise from people coming in/out and using the computer. If you are a light sleeper you may want to book a different category of room for just a little more money to avoid potential noise issues. I did not have an issue as I was dead tired and fell right asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: gilbertenstein
Reviews.Content: We booked online so didn't know what the rooms would be like in reality. They're not great but they're clean and comfortable. The big plus here is that the staff are very helpful in fact they are more helpful than most staff at 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room in this hotel, but only for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: DanaAb
Reviews.Content: In my book a good budget hotel must have unquestionable cleanliness, a comfortable bed and a decent bathroom/shower. Rating the Apex hotel against these I would give it a 'fair' rating. My first impression of the hotel was soured by the smell of bad plumbing that pervades the lobby and staircase. Luckily our room was odor free and looked generally clean. The decor was nice, if a bit kitschy. Our triple room had three single beds set in a row and felt a bit cramped at times. The bathroom was small but not tiny and had a modern looking shower. Unfortunately the fancy shower didn't work properly and the water trickled out of the shower head rather than exploded. The hotel has a free wireless internet connection, however the connection on our floor was not working. We reported it to the manager who promised to ask his 'friend' to come have a look at it. It was never fixed and the manager never followed up to see if we still had problems. We worked around the problem by connecting to the hotel's other very weak connection which worked most of the time but was slow and unstable. The hotel has a free breakfast served on the roof top every day from 7:30 to 10:30 but we were turned off trying it by the smell in the lobby. Despite all this, the hotel has some definite pluses. It was the cheapest hotel I found at the time in the Sultanahmet area. The beds were comfortable. The towels and sheets were clean and our room came with 3 nice bath robes in addition to the towels. So all in all not a terrible experience, but I would probably opt for another place on my future trips to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: BiancaNL
Reviews.Content: I found this little place through Trip Advisor. It's small and friendly and located at one of the most charming and quitest streets of the Sultan Ahmet area, yet close to the main tourist attractions. Above all service was excellent, at first by helping me getting around. Unfortunately I got quite ill at the second day of my stay in Turkey, but luckily they helped me out terrifically. By retreiving my (lost) luggage, postponing my onward flight and most importantly: by meeting all the needs a sick person had. A bit like home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in the heart of Old City”
Reviews.Author: Rostaluma
Reviews.Content: My husband and me spent 3 nights at the Apex Hotel and it has been a great deal! The hotel is nice, room clean and breakfast tasty. You get everything you need. Location is fantastic just few meters away from Blue Moschee, Saint Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The staff was really friendly and ready to satify our requests or to advice us where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Katyapal
Reviews.Content: Very nice cozy place - small and friendly. The whole area though is full of nice little hotels like this one. It's a great destination in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super-friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NomadicWombat
Reviews.Content: Apex is a good mid-budget hotel that is very conveniently located for all the sights of Old Istanbul. What makes it special are the people who work there. They make a great effort to be helpful and personable. For example, on my father's birthday, they surprised all of us with a cake.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!!”
Reviews.Author: rakeshmehra
Reviews.Content: One of the best properties i have stayed in, considering traveled all across the world. The owner Ibrahim along with his hotel staff was very helpful and charming. One of the best Indian restaurants is walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ricedish
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night at the very end of my trip, in the hopes of saving some money. The rest of my time in Istanbul, I stayed at Millennium Suites, which was wonderful, but cost more. Overall, excellent for the money. You'd never consider this a five-star hotel, but that's not what you should expect given the very low price. I think of this as a very cozy, serviceable boutique. The front staff is extremely friendly (almost a bit too friendly when you're exhausted, but can hardly blame them for that). The rooms are not huge, but comfortable enough. The beds are a bit on the hard side. And the bathroom is tiny tiny. Still, I enjoyed my one night here, and would stay again on this budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: blinknoodle
Reviews.Content: This place has a great location, with a central location but also quiet enough since it is further back from the main street. The staff are reasonably helpful, although at times I wondered whether they completely understood my questions. They, thankfully, helped us print our plane tickets the night before. We had difficulties with a missing plugin on the main computer, but in the end it was figured out. The rooms were small and my gripe is mainly with the washrooms. We couldn't figure out how to use the shower. The breakfast was buffet-style but fairly minimal. We had a hard time getting an early breakfast. The staff were usually still putting things together after we had finished and left. I don't think we were able to have anything that was served hot.

Reviews.Title: “harika.....!perfect......hotel at the best place!tessekur enderim from greeks!”
Reviews.Author: sundaysgroup
Reviews.Content: It was really very friendly the people and the place at the hotel......I m from Greece and really...I couldn t beleive that in turkish I would have the best vacations ever! The hotel has the anatolian character and the rooms as well...with very beautiful and hot design! Turkish people at the hotel very friendly!.....I m looking forward to go again there! Tessekur enderim kardasia

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and great location”
Reviews.Author: gurby
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel i stayed in my entire 3 week trip to Turkey. The staff are incredible. Always smiling and go out of there way to make sure u are comfortable. The location is fantastic. The hotel is walking distance to all the main sites including blue mosque, haggia sofia, topkapi palace, basilica cistern and even the grand bazaar. The rooms are clean and appear to be recently renovated and the rooftop terrace provides a great view at breakfast and an ideal place to relax. Simply love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, lovely staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelM00se
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location near all major sites in Sultanahmet. We were able to walk to all sites from the hotel. The staff is wonderful-- they made us feel welcome and made us laugh as well. The rooftop terrace is lovely with great views of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. There is also a quiet, shaded sitting area in front of the hotel, which is a nice place to rest, talk and have a cup of tea (which the staff always seemed happy to provide). The rooms were a bit small, but comfortable, quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “A customer friendly small hotel in a location convenient to the main sights.”
Reviews.Author: LuverlyJubbly
Reviews.Content: We were greeted like family on our arrival and throughout our stay treated almost as family by the hotel team. They went out of their way to help make our stay memorable. They were able to recommend good restaurents local to the hotel, provide travel tips and suggestions for sightseing. Rooms clean and comfortable, with working aircon. Ideal position for the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitability”
Reviews.Author: Gabi37
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, nice and near to the most important touristic attractions located in the old city of Istanbul. The staff is very friendly and ready anytime to meet the guests requirements.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: sunvalley-traveler25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the triple rooms for three or four nights and couldn't get over how nice the location was! Not too close to the train below and just far enough from the Blue Mosque as to not feel like "we were in" the morning prayer at 5:30 AM. The deck is a great blend of views of the sea, Prince's Islands, and Blue Mosque. We really enjoyed spending time up there every morning and evening. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We were within comfortable walking distance of everything we came to see. Much more than I expected for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service makes all the difference.”
Reviews.Author: nettwerkjohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in all sorts of places, backpackers thru to 5 star hotels. And, whilst the Apex is certainly not a 5-star hotel, our stay there was one of the best we've had anywhere. The staff there are the best - friendly, attentive, courteous, helpful. They made our stay in Istanbul very pleasant. We also got a great rate, at which we believe it to be a bargain. Negatives:the breakfast wasn't the best we've had in Istanbul, and it is a little difficult to find at first, but hey, thats Sultanhamet. We'd recommend the place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: david_2010_10
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Apex Hotel for the second time in a year and thoroughly enjoyed my time there. It is just a short walk to the seaside, fish restaurants, and pubs and restaurants below the Blue Mosque. The hotel is located on a quiet street. The service is impeccable. Emrah is forever helpful at the front desk and Ibrahim makes sure everything is in top order for you. These guys are more like great friends or family! They make me feel at home in Istanbul, and I will certainly stay there again. See you guys at the White House! David

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dokitaro
Reviews.Content: I don't have enough nice things to say about this hotel. It was clean, excellent location, quiet (we were on the top floor) and the staff were unbelievably friendly and helpful. It's about 5 minutes walk from the Haga Sophia and Blue Mosque, and not far from other sights. Rooms are fairly spacious, clean and the decor is great. We had a few cupboard door handles come loose, but even that just seems to add to the charm! The staff are fantastic, will offer any amount of help and welcome you to sit and order pizza with them! Really nice place, great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, excellent service, remodeled rooms!”
Reviews.Author: psk219
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the Apex Hotel, I was greeted by young employees who couldn't do enough for me. From handling my luggage, to bringing me tea and then bottled water, to helping me figure out how to turn the tv on, to fixing the toilet from continuously flushing, they were terrific. Happy to be at their jobs and happier to be of assistance, the team at the Apex Hotel made my stay warm, friendly, safe and enjoyable. The location is walking distance to the Blue Mosque and the other must-see mosques and museums. Restaurants are also walking distance. The rooms have been remodeled recently and were more than adequate. Not luxurious but well appointed, clean. It had everything I needed plus a safe deposit box in the room, slippers and robes. The room was small; the bathroom also small but very clean. The shower was a corner style so room to move in it was minimal. I liked the employees the best and the smoke filtering inside from the outside, the least. But this is Turkey and most people smoke!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice staff and very good location”
Reviews.Author: Tropos
Reviews.Content: Our stay was part of a quite long trip. We had a not pleasant surprise at first as the double room was not available. After a friendly discussion we got the room. The staff, mainly young people, Emrah and the other guys, were extremely nice and helpful all the time. All the stay was very good. The hotel, a tipical boutique is ok, but could be better. The location, in old Sulthahmet is very good, close to a lot of historical places and not far from the tramway, which is very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality in its best”
Reviews.Author: Rowing_by
Reviews.Content: A lot is written about hospitality of people working in this hotel. What can I add? I can only assure you that it's really true! I has just asked about possibility of changing room to the one with the city view and in five minutes I was moving my luggage without any additional charge. And finally before my leaving I got a wonderfull turkish coffe from guest relations girl who really cares about all guests. The only thing which can bother is that everything what is screwed in the wall do not work :) I mean they need to take new screws and make it again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: sashkin2000
Reviews.Content: Apex is a perfect place to stay - nice and warm atmosphere, friendly staff, comfortable (not large) rooms, good terrace view, calm street, near most of Istanbul attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nonexistent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: nowisee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in walking distance to all the major sights and some of the best restaurants in Istanbul. So if you dont mind small rooms with some mold and having to buy breakfast at local shops you will have a great stay. When we arrived at the hotel the first day/night we where given a room with 3 beds on the third floor. The manager tried to explain that this was because the room we where supposed to have was taken and that the next day we could have that room. Not that i understood everything he said but that was fine. I think the manager called the room we got the first night a "family" room. The first night i woke up at around 3'o clock when the garbage truck collected garbage. Then at 6, to the call of prayer from a minaret. So if you are a light sleeper i would suggest you get some earplugs like i did. The next day we went to get some breakfast at the terrace before we started our long day of sightseeing. The breakfast had a small selection of cold cuts and cheese, not the kind of cold cuts im used to and it looked as if it had been on the tray for some time. There was also a selection of cerials, but no milk. And the bread was limited to one type of white bread. We do a lot of traveling and this is one of the worst breakfasts we have had on a hotel. Food is cheap and it would have cost them so little to have a brown bread and some better cold cuts. All in all this hotel is ok, but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “romantic heaven to stay with”
Reviews.Author: Irmona
Reviews.Content: A stylish cozy boutique hotel with great room accommodations, polite and helpful staff and excellent pricing. Centrally located to all essential sightseeing of Istanbul right in heart of historical part of Istanbul - Sultanahmet, this is a MUST stay for those in on personal travel and even romantic vacations. By the way, it is located in a quiet area surrounded with fairy tail and other beautiful small hotels within 5 minutes from Aia Sofia, Blue Mosk and may be 10 minutes from Grand Bazaar. I have stayed at this Apex hotel on several occasions now and rate it very reasonable. Why? Because the service is excellent, the staff are consistently pleasant and helpful, go out of their way to assist and the room I continue to choose has excellent light and views (such as they are). Apex design concept is made in luxury classic style to feel comfortable and relaxing inside. Each room has a big bed, rich decorated windows and mirror and even plate with various choice of coffee and tea with some sweets that makes it more feel like and home. Front desk staff was very friendly and even advised me how to get to places and where to dine, took for wonderful shopping and informed about night life. Overall, a wonderful stay in Apex hotel. Will definitely revisit again ;)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent little hotel with very friendly staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Blah60
Reviews.Content: An excellent little hotel with very friendly staff in a great location in central istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great people!”
Reviews.Author: mzyxhsme
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel in the heart of the main historical district in Istanbul. Our room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast (Coffee, tea, bread, cheese, meats, etc) on the rooftop was fantastic way to start the day. The hotel staff are fantastic, going out of their way on many many occasions to help, give advice and make our stay more enjoyable. If we go back to Istanbul we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for its price. Excellent staff who go out of their way to help tourists”
Reviews.Author: Admiral18
Reviews.Content: One of the best things about this hotel is its location and its hospitality. It is located in Sulthanahmet, old town of Istanbul, and has many tourists attractions at a walking distance. Besides, the staff gave good recommendations regarding tours, etc and were otherwise very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to someone who's looking for a good value for money. Ofcourse its not like a 5 Star hotel with all great amenities, but what you're paying for, its definitely worth it. Good luck! On a separate note, please beware of taxi drivers of Istanbul. They are EXPERTS in ripping off foreigners. We experienced several times them changing a 50 Lira note to 5 Lira (since both resemble in color) and claiming that we only gave them 5 Lira. Always get out of the cab and pay change (if possible). This has nothing to do with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You will not find a better hotel...truly amazing”
Reviews.Author: Sayyid
Reviews.Content: If you want peace of mind...choose Apex hotel If you want to feel at home.. choose Apex hotel If you want a beautiful buffet breakfast overlooking the Bosphorus and Blue Mosque... choose Apex hotel If you want staff to meet all your need... choose Apex hotel If you want spotless clean rooms... choose Apex hotel If you want to be picked up from the airport... choose Apex hotel If you want advice on what to do during your time in Istanbul... choose Apex hotel If you want value for money... choose Apex hotel If you want free internet... choose Apex hotel If you want a hotel that is 2mins walk from Arasta Bazaar, 4mins from Blue Mosque, 6mins from Hagia Sofia, 7mins from Sultanahmet tram station, the Hippodrome, the tomb of Sultanahmet, the Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum, Topkapi Palace... choose Apex hotel If you want to visit Istanbul choose Apex hotel, as not even a 5* hotel could match this hotel's friendliness, beautiful environment and peace of mind. The staff were truly amazing. Emrah the receptionist was wonderful. I chose Apex hotel simply based on their reviews on TripAdvisor and I would recommend anyone to go there. The manager Ibrahim was first class and me and my wife were truly saddened when we had to leave Istanbul. Despite it snowing for 4 days during our visit, they still managed to ensure we enjoyed ourselves in Istanbul by giving us priceless tips that you would never find in a guide book. Apex hotel in one word...BRILLIANT

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Liam72
Reviews.Content: The staff of the Apex Hotel were wonderful, the free buffet breakast was generous and the location of the hotel is incredible! Easily the best value in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent french fries for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Slavc0
Reviews.Content: Staff extraordinarily friendly and welcoming. The breakfast was very good and tasty, clean rooms, nearness of the historical sights, free transfer from Attaturk Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trvlr2010
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed the Apex Hotel. Our room was very small (what do you expect at these prices), but was clean and comfortable. There are some great included perks, like free breakfast, lots of tea and coffee in the room, and a free airport shuttle (if you stay long enough). We were continually impressed with the staff -- they were exceptionally friendly and cheerful. If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel in Sultanahmet, you can't go wrong with the Apex!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, caring and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: NoorPalijo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Apex hotel for four nights and I must admit all the staff were very friendly and helpful. They do not speak English as good as I would expect in England but you can communicate quite easily. They arranged hotel for me in Cappadocia and gave them personal assurance that I will not cancel the booking. They helped me find an economical flight to Konya and helped me book on Turkish Airline's Turkish website, as the same flight was TL100 dearer on the English website. I stayed at three more hotels in Turkey but their breakfast was better than all others. My parents are planning to visit Istanbul this April and I have already suggested them to stay at Apex.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: mzhoque
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, reviewing the comments on the hotel on Trip Advisor. I found the experience of staying in the hotel excellent. The front desk is extremely helpful and gave us good advice on the tours and transport arrangements. The rooms were decent and we found our stay very enjoyable. A great bargain for the price we paid. Zahid

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Lives to its Name”
Reviews.Author: Priyankb
Reviews.Content: Apex is an Awesome experience for us (me & my wife). We got more than we expected after reading reviews about hotel from the hotel and its staff. I would specially like to mention about the kind of guidance Emrah(receptionist)has provided us in exploring Istanbul and its lesser known places. He has answers to all our queries during our stay in Hotel, and more importantly the answers were perfect. Thank you Emrah & entire Apex Hotel staff for all your support during our memorable stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel and wonderfull staf, the best option in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Pipones
Reviews.Content: We are a family with two small boys, my children specially enjoyed the hotel, the staff is absolutely friendly and love the children, we felt as at home. I fully recommend this hotel specially to families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, exceeds expectation,”
Reviews.Author: nadim80
Reviews.Content: Location amazing 2 minute walking from Aya Sophia and sultan ahmet money value amazing, staff friendliness beyond expectations, room have an amazing design, i recommend it to any budget traveller family, the Manager Ibrahim and the working staff Emrah and Osman were very friendly people and i would go there again,

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: moddington
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, the room was lovely, not very big but you're out and about during the day. The staff were excellent, very very helpful and friendly, the location is fantastic-right in the heart of Sultanahmet, lot's of restauraunts and bars just around the corner, yet at night it was very peaceful. It's very near the Blue Mosque-no better location! The attention to detail in the rooms was great, slippers, fluffy dressing gowns, toiletries, kettle, tea, coffee etc- TV too! There's also a safe- not that we felt like we needed one but it's there anyway, minibar too- everything you could wish for and 24hour reception staff who actually want to help you. GREAT TIP- to get back to the airport- taxi costs 30 Euros- get on the tram near the Blue Mosque to Zeytinburnu, then transfer to the Metro for the airport (Ataturk)-it will cost you about 2 euros each-takes just over an hour but it's a bargain- not really used much by tourists, it's so easy -just check out the trams first so you know what you're doing- it's easy when you know how!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Hospitable, Clean, Excellent Location & Well Priced!”
Reviews.Author: AussieLegend
Reviews.Content: Great little place! Stayed with my girlfriend and another couple. We had orange juice and coffees on arrival, all the help possible during our stay and sandwiches on departure! Staff are lovely, rooms are traditional and very clean. Would definitely go back and would Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: rustyman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in October. Room is traditional, clean, quite small and a little tired......but I'd definitely go back. The location is great, safe and the staff, every one of them could not do enough for us. They even made sandwiches for us on our departure at 5:30am, we din't ask for them, and they had coffee for us at the back of 5am. It was bucketing it down on our last day so the guy at reception gave us a brolly. No matter what I asked for they said everything is possible. So if you're happy not staying in a 4 or 5 star hotel then try the Apex. By the way if you stay here then book a table at the seafood restaurand 50 yards along the road, Balikci Sabhatin.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location with perfect ambiance”
Reviews.Author: LRCcincy
Reviews.Content: Located just steps from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the historic cistern and Topkapi Palace. The rooftop terrace breakfast buffet affords a breathtaking view of the Sultanahmet district, the Sea of Marmara and the Bosphorus. The Apex is a jewel with a friendly knowledgeable staff. ,

Reviews.Title: “Great place at great price”
Reviews.Author: KTBlount
Reviews.Content: After reading the other review online, I decided to book this hotel. My email inquiries were always answered in a timely fashion, and were always polite. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Lokman Yunushan, the person whom I had been emailing with. He could not have been any more hospitable or polite. We were treated like family, and offered our choice of a double room or a triple. Although there were just the two of us, we chose the triple room. It is about the size of a standard US room, but there are three twin beds. The double was very small with only one double bed, so we opted for the extra space. The room was clean and comfortable, with a modern shower and clean bathroom. In the morning, you can go up to the terrace to experience what a breakfast in Istanbul consists of. Keep in mind that you are in Turkey, and do not expect a typical American breakfast. Hard boiled eggs, toast, small sausages, meats, olives, cerial, and other items make up the spread. It is all served with pride by one of the staff members - in our case a very polite young man that wears a bow tie and takes his job very seriously. The day we left, I went up to the terrace to take his picture and he was extremely surprised that I would want to take a picture of him. He stood erect and took this job as seriously as he did with the food. All in all, I enjoyed our stay at the Apex and would recommend it to anyone wanting a clean, friendly place at a decent price. Many thanks to Lokman who was just a pleasure to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet well run hotel convenient for all the sites”
Reviews.Author: blueferret
Reviews.Content: Whilst possibly not the most glamorous hotel you could book it was well managed and very very hospitable. The manager and staff were ever helpful without being pushy, in fact when a better room became available at short notice we were offered it at no extra cost. The rooms were comfortable and breakfast was enjoyable one the roof terrace. And it was conveniently located near the blue mosque so site seeing was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly owner/staff, great value.”
Reviews.Author: GreatFalls
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended our trip to Turkey with a 4-night stay at the Apex Hotel. The hotel was located within walking distance to all the main sites that we wanted to visit, 5-10 minutes by foot to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, the Basilica Cistern, with other sites/locations such as Grand Bazaar, Spice Market and Galata Bridge just a bit further, but still most enjoyable walks (once you learn to ignore the persistent street peddlers/restaurant hawkers). The hotel manager, Mr. Ibrahim Billik, and the front desk managers were genuinely friendly and helpful. They provided directions, sightseeing advice, and a nice welcome whenever we entered the hotel. We had the feeling that the staff would go well out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. There are a few things, in my opinion, of which potential visitors should be aware: first, the rooms are not very large (especially the single room we had on our first night's stay); second, there was no seating in either of the two rooms we had during on our visit, although the second room (a double/triple) would have been large enough to accommodate a small table with a couple of small chairs; and third, we found the breakfasts, buffets on the roof veranda, to be just passable, with small selection of items and eggs that were not quickly refilled when they had already been consumed by other guests. That said, these quibbles were far outweighed by the ways in which this hotel did excel. As mentioned, the location couldn't be better and the courtesy of the staff was superb (also, the neighborhood felt very safe, for anyone concerned with this aspect of travel). The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable, and the air conditioner worked well. While we couldn't sit comfortably in our rooms with no chairs, this was more than compensated for by having available a roof veranda that had wonderful views of the Bosporus in one direction and the Blue Mosque in the other. When my wife and I returned in the evening to the hotel after dinner and/or sightseeing, we would go up to the veranda with some tea or ice cream (not too much wine/alcohol in Istanbul) where we could watch the sun setting on the Bosporus, see the Blue Mosque minarets illuminated by spotlights, and listen to the nightly calls to prayer from both the Blue Mosque and a smaller mosque across the street from the hotel, each muezzin seeming to respond to the others' call with an answering call. It really made Istanbul come alive. All in hotel, we enjoyed our stay at the Apex Hotel and found it to be great value for the money. Subject to the review above, we would highly recommend the Apex Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Shelyr
Reviews.Content: We can't understand the good reviews this hotel has received in the past on TripAdvisor - which was the only reason we chose it! This hotel is overpriced, not particularly clean and across the road from two excellent hotels either of which would be a much better choice. The friendliness of the staff does not compensate for the tired rooms, average breakfast and scruffy decor. If you are looking for an hotel in this area of Sultanamet try the Ferman or the Aveccina across the street which are a similar price and of a much higher standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not great hotel....”
Reviews.Author: GrahlindWales
Reviews.Content: First time to Istanbul, wonderful city!! Hotel was good, but cannot see why it is so popular with Tripadvisor reviewers? It is a good three star hotel, no more. The room was probably the smallest I have ever stopped in! Breakfast was on roof top, it rained the last two days and was quite cold. I realise that for most of the year Istanbul is sunny, but there were no area to eat indoors? Staff were very helpful and friendly, and excellent location. I appreciate the price we paid, 50 Euro's per night, for the area we were stopping was very good value, and some great restaurants also, but sorry, cannot see what all the fuss is about.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff the most helpful ever found”
Reviews.Author: cmwMundesley_Norfolk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with another couple. We are all well travelled & rated the hotel highly. Ideal for a short break visit., and within easy walking distance of Blue Mosque & good restaurants. The rooms were modest, but clean and the beds the most comfortable we have found in some time. The staff were so friendly & helpful...the owner vetted my list of suggested restaurants, and the desk readily telephoned attractions to check on opening times etc. & to book restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: DAGK
Reviews.Content: Nice Turkish boutique Hotel ( seems like there are dozens of these today!) in a good area within walking distance to the major tourist sights. There are manynhotels that have the same amenities and location as this hotel but, what set this hotel is the service. the people working at this hotel are top notch.

Reviews.Title: “If you go once, you will go again!”
Reviews.Author: KimonAthens
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutiqe hotel, in the historical centre of Istanbul, in a quite and beautiful little street, only 5 minutes walk from Saint Sofia and the tram stop. The personel is very friendly, kind, willing, helpful, polite. The rooms are very clean with nice decoration. A little bit small but no problem. The breakfast is full of goods, what I expected to find. Nothing more and nothing less than a good hotel breakfast! Thank you Apex, I enjoyed my visit to your hotel and I hope to visit Istanbul again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Teacher060
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and friendly, helpful people managing the hotel. Lots of good restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Like going for a visit to friends”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris78gr
Reviews.Content: A very nice and cozy boutique hotel. As expected, the rooms were relatively limited in space (especially the single ones). However, the friendliness and politeness of the owner and staff were outweighing the space limitations. Very close to the main attractions of the medieval town. Clean and quiet. Maybe the price could be a little cheaper. Still, I totally suggest it, especially if one doesn't require amenities of a luxury hotel and can cope with something more modest. I am definitely coming back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel, in a perfect location with excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Yiouli
Reviews.Content: Apex Hotel is situated in a very quit neibourghood in the heart of historical Istanbul. Hotel staff is perfect, they can give you tips on cruises, on sightseeing, on dinning, on taxis... The rooms are very nice decoraded, clean, with many facilities (they have many different choises for having tea in the room). Breakfast for local standards is good. I will totally recomment this hotel to all my friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: BethGranbury
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed at such a friendly hotel. We spent four days in Instanbul and Ibrahim and his staff were delightful. They could not do enough for us. We came in late one night and his family was having a wonderful meal on the terrace and they insisted we join them. The food was all home cooked and was great. The location was great and the air-conditioning worked great. Jack and LInda, Granbury, Texas

Reviews.Title: “One of my best hotel experiences in my travels”
Reviews.Author: b_nittmo
Reviews.Content: I saw this place on Trip Advisor when I was planning my trip to Istanbul and thought I'd give it a shot. I was very impressed with this small, intimate hotel. While I was there, I had a touch of bronchitis and the hotel manager walked with me to the pharmacy and bought me some cough medicine. I've never had anyone go that far out of thier way to make me happy at a hotel before. Not only is the service incredible, the location is perfect for travelers looking to see all the sights of Istanbul. I can't say enough nice things about this place. If I ever go back to Istanbul, this is the place I'm going to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrahamOToronto
Reviews.Content: Ibrahim and his colleagues at this wonderful hotel could not have done more to make us feel welcome and comfortable. I would go back here again in a shot if I could! Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel- the staff were amazing!”
Reviews.Author: minty_b
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated in a prime spot, nearby the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. All the main attractions are within walking distance. The staff are amazing, often going above and beyond to make us comfortable. They even invited us to break their fast with them. They were very friendly and sociable, and arranged transport to and from the airport, so there were no hassles on the last day trying to find a taxi. However, the streets are cobbled, so make sure to wear comfortable shoes. It is almost impossible to wear high heels!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel with a heart and soul”
Reviews.Author: sharex13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like being at home, Ibrahim and his staff treat you like family. When I originally arrived at the hotel I was very distraught, first by the nightmare of a flight from Casablanca to Istanbul, and that topped off with lost luggage. By time I got to the hotel I was in tears, it was 7 in the morning and I hadn't slept for over 24 hours. The first thing I was told to do was get some sleep and we would take care of everything after I rested. When I did wake up I felt a lot better. Ibrahim contacted AMEX for me to discuss my luggage protection plan. He then offered me food, but what was really amazing was that he sent one of his staff to take me shopping for some replacement clothes etc. I was taken from store to store, my bags were carried for me and also my receipts. He also arranged a trip on the Bosphorus for me and a private guide for a tour of the city. Upon returning from these tours he made sure that there were not problems, that the guides were good etc. He also had a friend who helped me plan my trips to Cappadoccia, Pamukkale, and cruise on the Meditterean, from Feythia to Olympos. Now my missing bag arrived 3 days later but was no longer usable. I was leaving early the next morning for the rest of my trip so he lent me his suitcase till I returned to Istanbul. That night I asked where I could get a bottle of wine and he didn't want me to get ripped off so he went to the liquor store and brought back 4 bottles for me to choose from and then took the 3 bottles back to the store. When I returned to Istanbul he again took me shopping for a suitcase after telling me I didn't need one but could keep his. I was even invited to break fast (it was during Ramadan) with him and his friends. I travel extensively around the world and I have never come across service like this from the personel at a hotel. Ibrahim is a hands on owner/manager who goes out of his way to make you feel comfortable and happy. The hotel is very good value, clean, and close to most tourist attractions. On a scale from 1-10 I would give this hotel a 10+++++. I will never forget my experience in Turkey and I will never forget my new family at the APEX, which is with out a doubt the hotel with a heart and soul.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: hsm67
Reviews.Content: Superb!!! I stayed alongwith my family for three days at the hotel. And I was amazed by the hospitality of the staff who seemed to be no less than a family. Situated close to most of the tourist attractions, it was a perfect place to be. One of the most memorable stays i had away from home. The hotel facilities were immaculate and the services highly appreciable.It all made us fall in love with Istanbul and its people. Wish all the best. Dr Hamid.

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely friendly - couldn't do enough to help”
Reviews.Author: PatchMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and choose to stay in the smaller "character" hotels in the centre of town. From previous experience choosing the right boutique hotel can be quite hit and miss -but the Apex was a delight. The facilities and location were really good and the cost the best we experienced this summer in Europe - perhaps more importantly the service was fantastic. Just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with super views and even better service!”
Reviews.Author: millsm123
Reviews.Content: Ibrahim and his team were great from the moment we entered the hotel. They make you feel at home and cater to any need or request that you have. They helped recommend many of the restaurants and bars we went to and we were pleased with all of them. They really are a genuine group of people that want to help. The hotel is very comfortable and has a lot of charm. It's in a excellent location with a 5 minute walk to all the top sights. Apex is more than worth the money and I'd recommend them to everyone. If I go back, I already know where I am staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, charm and views”
Reviews.Author: SKSKNewYork
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. Staff was extremely friendly and attentive. We loved having the delicious breakfast on the rooftop terrace with views of the Blue Mosque and the Marmaran Sea. Location was perfect for seeing the main sights and the street was very quaint. Our kids felt most welcome, too. Rooms were on the small side but very clean with comfortable beds. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: RedindianLondon
Reviews.Content: A perfect location within minutes walking distance of the Blue Mosque and the historical centre of Istanbul. The hotel is in a very quiet cobblestoned road that fortunately misses out on traffic and crowds. The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. They kept a low profile; always on hand to help if needed but without imposing themselves. The rooms were clean and comfortable with amazing character. We felt at ease throughout our stay; it provided a base for a very relaxed, comfortable and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: gm0u90b2
Reviews.Content: M wife and I stayed at the Apex hotel this month for 7 nights. It is an absolutely fantastic hotel, with everything you could possibly need. Great location on a lovely little street, clean rooms (which are full of character) and a roof terrace for eating breakfast on. The staff are friendly and helpful and so welcoming. I really couldn't reccommend this hotel any more highly. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vidalson
Reviews.Content: This hotel boutique is really very good! Ok...the furniture wants to seem elegant and it's really old-fashioned, not according with the status of the hotel....but it's even funny. But the best of all, with no doubt, is the service; the people working there really wants you to be well and confortable: we arrived at 6 a.m. Our room was not ready, but they gave us another one, so we could had a shower and rest for a while...until the breakfast: they gave us breafkast buffet...for free!!! At 9:30 we could enter to our room, very spacious and with the typical carpets in the turkish hotels. The hotel is very well situtated, in a calm street, in a beautiful neighbourhood full of wooden houses and only 2 minuts walking to SultanAhmet Mosquee (the "blue one"). Breakfast is very good also, as you are in a terrace with a great views. So...hotel 100% recomendable, due its situation and, over all, thanks to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in the old city Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: zmd71
Reviews.Content: There was a four days where we spent our times in a plesant way. Our guests made us to feel in their hotel like in our home. Many thanks to Mr. Ibrahim and his nephew.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, exceptional location and the best service I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: AdamK82
Reviews.Content: I have travelled quite extensively and I can honestly say that the Apex Hotel is the best hotel I have every stayed at. What differentiates this hotel from all others is the customer service which quite simply is at a level which I have never experienced and doubt I will ever again. As this is a small boutique hotel, run personally by the owner and his fantastic staff they truly treat you as though you are part of the family. I was welcomed with drinks and fruit and given a detailed description of what to do and where to go in Istanbul, and on the day i left they provided me lunch as i waited to go the airport. The staff were always there to help with any question I had. The rooms are great, the airconditioning fantastic which is vital considering the heat of Istanbul in summer. There is free wireless internet which is a must in hotels these days. The location of the hotel is perfect, less than a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and the other main tourist attractions. Before I booked this hotel I read the reviews on this site and can only confirm everything that is said. The owner has put his heart and soui into this hotel, and I only wish that all the other hotels I had stayed at provided the same level of service that the Apex Hotel does. I strongly recommend you stay at this hotel when you come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing service and location.”
Reviews.Author: meirahuva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Apex hotel with my wife and two friends for two nights. There is no better location for a hotel in Istanbul. The service and the cleanliness in the hotel was above anything I have ever since and I have stayed in many hotels before. The concierge and the manager were very friendly, we felt very comfortable talking to them and asking them questions. Breakfast was average but good, and our room specifically was a little bit small. We strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mostad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very small and cosy hotel, had a soul to it (also meaning a little old). It is very close to the Blue Mosque and many restaurants. Rooms are a little small but ok. The staff is very friendly and speak well english. I like the outside breakfast on the roof with a view of the city. The breakfast it self was ok. For the price it was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honest and hospitable staff, amazing service, and beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: CocoOno
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the integrity and friendliness of the owner and staff of Apex. They assisted us with every aspect of our stay, from river cruises, to dining recommendations, and advice on where to find the best values (and hidden treasures) in Instanbul. The rooms are clean, the air conditioning is great, and internet is free! Best of all, they have comfortable deck space overlooking the skyline, including the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus river. If you stay more than three nights, they'll either pick you up or drop you off at the airport, for free (about a twenty Euro fare per person otherwise). To give you an understanding of how honest and hospitable the owner is, he offered to pay for our ride back to the airport after one of our other friends had already used up the free promotion. The guys (and gals) at Apex are truly top-notch. We'll be going back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sydneysida
Reviews.Content: Boutique Apex is a great place to stay for a visit to Istanbul. It is superbly located within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque. Rooms are clean and comfortable. There was wireless internet available. Importantly the staff were the friendliest and most helpful of any of the hotels we stayed at during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Boris_SVK
Reviews.Content: Apex hotel was great.... it is as the photos show. It's situated in a great location to explore Istanbul.The staff are friendly, polite and very helpful. Free wifi is a great advantage as well. I will recommend this hotel to everybody. :)

Reviews.Title: “Why is this hotel so popular?”
Reviews.Author: RoadRutz
Reviews.Content: I agree with others that the staff here are friendly and helpful, but frankly the hotel itself is just one step up from a hostel. Our room was like an oven when we checked in -- it took the small, noisy air conditioner over an hour to get it to a habitable temperature. The room was small, the paint chipped and peeling off picture frames and the bed's headboard. Every hanger in the place was loose on the wall. The toilet would not stop filling; the hotel manager called "his friend" to fix it, but the friend either never turned up or didn't manage the repair. Both mirrors were mounted so low that I had to bend down uncomfortably to shave or brush my hair. The shower was tiny and the doors didn't close properly. One knob was missing off the shower control. When we checked in, the 'minibar' was unplugged and contained two bottles of warm water of unknown vintage. We could use either the fridge or the kettle or the TV, but not any two at once as they shared the same wall plug. There was nowhere to sit except on the bed. At least the bed was comfortable and the hotel is well located for doing touristy things, but I am sure there must be dozens of better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: nate_the_dogg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great staff, and great location. The first few nights I was there I had jet lag and cold not sleep. At 4 am, starving to death, I wandered to the lobby to see where I could get some food. The staff was nice enough to prepare me a plate of food, with juice and water all free of charge. They did this a few nights (until I ended up being able to sleep on a normal schedule). They were extremely, extremely nice. We shopped around for a number of hotels and this one had one of the best prices. I stayed for a week with my wife. The location is great. The rooms are small by North American standards, but average size for European standards. We ended up staying in a "triple", which has 1 double bed and 1 single. I would definitely recommend upgrading to this size, since there is considerably more room than a double, even if there is only 2 people. The breakfast buffet is OK, but not spectacular. There is an assortment of breads, jams, cheeses, etc. The coffee was great. The AC worked great, and everything was very clean. For the price, the hotel is a fantastic deal, and the staff is the nicest that I have ever come across. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone that cannot afford ot stay in the swanky four seasons hotel a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel with Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: dxzium
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Apex Hotel to spend my last night in Turkey and I could wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for the service alone. I arrived in Istanbul from my excursion in Bodrum early in the morning and on my way to the hotel I ran into the service staff who served breakfast who kindly assisted me with my luggage in one hand as he carried fresh groceries in the other. While they did not have an extra room available for me to do an early check-in, they invited me to their breakfast buffet consisting of various juices, coffee, cheeses, sausages, fruits, etc. and some fresh produce / bread from the local market. A modest breakfast overall and a bit different from the Western breakfasts I am accustomed to, but pleasant nonetheless atop the rooftop terrace. The room I had at the Apex seemed rather small compared to most other hotels I've stayed at, but for a single traveler it was more than spacious enough and had a very nice touch of "home". The bathroom was also very clean and all the facilities were in good condition. Having been given a tour by the hotel owner and seen the different rooms available at the Apex, it is fair to say this hotel is improving still with flooring and furniture replacements. However, I do have two reservations about the rooms: first, the lighting was inadequate--do not expect to read after sundown in the room without eyestrain; and second, the air conditioner in my particular room did not seem to do much cooling (although the windows were enough for the mild early-June weather). The location of the hotel is great, located in convenient walking distance from all the great attractions including the bazaar. Public transportation (the tram) is a fair ten minutes from the hotel and will take you to the airport (with one transfer-- very cheap and convenient). Note, however, that there are hills near the hotel (meaning sidewalks are littered with steps) and the pavement is close to a brick-like texture of stone. If you have a heavier, rolling, suitcase, it may be difficult to navigate comfortably on foot. Also note that taxis are not allowed to travel through the Sultanahmet area (that separates the tram and the hotel). However, the helpful staff actually assisted me in bringing my bags to the tram (!!), a true example of Turkish hospitality. My overall experience at the Apex was excellent and I encourage anyone looking for a comfortable and convenient place to stay at the Apex.

Reviews.Title: “APEX Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussieadanac
Reviews.Content: Spent five wonderful days in Istanbul at APEX Hotel. Hi to Ibrahim and his staff. Staff had lots of good ideas for sightseeing and restaruants. Central location close to all the Sights. Istanbul was very warm, we found a lovely sea wall walk about five minutes from the hotel - felt about 20 degrees cooler by the ocean! Great view of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop patio. Our room was on the third floor facing the street, it was quiet and comfortable. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: strixje
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed ourselves very much this week. The hotel has a perfect location, so if you want to go to the bazaar or the mosque you only have to walk a few steps. There are also many museums and monuments. The rooms are very tidy and clean and you got everything you need for your vacation. The breakfast on the roof is very nice and the staff gives you all the service you need. So if we ever go back to the same region we will definately stay in Apex hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tek71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Apex hotel in the end of May, 2009. Very nice small hotel, only 12 numbers. An ideal location - 5 minutes walking distance to historical places of Istanbul. Bedrooms and bathrooms are not so big, but comfortable, very clean with fresh towels every day. Free wireless Internet is also a nice touch. Breakfast is included up on a roof terrace with an incredible view to Bosporus and the Blue mosque. Very friendly and helpful staff. In a hall of hotel always suggested to drink a cup of tea or coffee. I think, that it is very good hotel under quite reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great staff :)”
Reviews.Author: adinkaaa
Reviews.Content: Istanbul became one of my favorite cities because of its special atmosphere, numerous world - famous historical sights, delicious cuisine, great music and of course, very friendly people. All in all, city itself is wonderful to explore. :) As for this hotel, I must say that it was a good choice. It is a nice little hotel with family atmosphere. The best thing about Apex Hotel is its location - in Sultanahmet, so everything that is worth seeing in Istanbul is within a short walking distance. For example it takes just approximatelly 3 (!!) minutes to walk to Blue Mosque, isn't it amazing? :)This hotel is situated quite close to Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and Hagia Sophia as well. Rooms are decorated in a classical Turkish style, they are clean and beds are veeery comfortable ;p ..bathroom is ok too..so no problem at all. Breakfast is served on roof terrace which has a view of the area (Blue Mosque on one side and Sea of Marmara on another side) ..simply amazing! Well, the breakfast is simple yet sufficient however I didnâ€˜t like it very much. And as for the staff, they are amazing! They try to do their best and to make guests feel like at home :) I really appreciate it, because actually it's the first hotel I stayed in where I saw such a friendly and helpful staff who care. In my opinion, they should add one more star * to hotel for the staff :) Yes, it's not 5* hotel, but it's deffinitely a great place to stay. I'm sure I will stay in this hotel again next time when I come to Istanbul and I hope it will be soon!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot see what others see in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blossom55
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say that the management and staff are warm, pleasant and do their best for you. Many thanks to the lovely young man, Tosun I believe, who serves breakfast. For us, the accommodation was really not up to par, nor was it good value for money. Our room was dark and cramped. It was one of 2 on the ground floor. The lighting was really very deficient within the room. The floor was extremely uneven to walk on. The toilet seat, in the bathroom was broken. The sink leaked over the floor, from its base, perpetually. The bathroom, like the room was extremely small. Realising that this situation may have been confined to our particular room, when ascending the stairs to the breakfast room, where there were open doors, we did peer inside to see if there was imprved accommodation on upper floors. To us, there was not really much improvement witnessed, regarding spaciousness. The manager was apologetic and let us know that he was aware of the standard of the room, but stated he had no other to offer. I had booked our accommodation last year. Mainly due to reading reviews on this web site. Booking that far ahead, and being in direct contact with the hotel, several times, prior to arrival, I wrongly assumed that we would be given a better room than we supplied with. The turkish people are very kind and generous and this etablishment is no exception. Our hosts were generous, but if I had been aware before arriving in Istanbul of the standard of accommodation I woukd have booked elsewhere. Nice people do not ensure a comfortable nights sleep or bathroom experience.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly base in the heart of historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cgtree
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We had a great 6 day stay. The hotel is in a perfect location in a relatively quiet road just around the corner from a street of cafes, restaurants and rug shops and less than five minutes from the Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque. The inclusive breakfast is adequate. The rooms are adequate, as you will be out and about the sites or local cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, wonderfully friendly staff and a good value too!!”
Reviews.Author: kchurch49
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights in Istanbul; the last three spent at the Apex Hotel. This hotel is in a great location , so close to everything important to visit in Istanbul. My husband and I were really overwhelmed by the helpful and friendly staff. They even filled our request for a bucket of ice late at night so we could try some Raki! Where does THAT happen in Europe? a BUCKET of ICE ! This place is a good value too; the rooms are comfortable with T.V. ( if you really must watch the news) and the rate includes an adequate breakfast on their rooftop terrace. We would absolutely recommend APEX to anyone traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely owner!”
Reviews.Author: pongowaring
Reviews.Content: I think I will just be reinforcing what everyone else has said! This is a quirky lovely little hotel slap bang in the middle of all the tourist sites, but down a little (safe) side road, so it is quiet. It is clean, super comfy beds. The breakfasts are fine, but was the one thing that could be improved on. The best bit about Apex is the owner Ibrahim. We had to return to the UK urgently whilst in Istanbul and he could not have been more helpful or kind in what was a difficult time for us. I doubt very much that the four seasons up the road would have helped us in the way that the staff at the Apex did. Do yourself a favour and stay at the Apex- we certainly will be should we go to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “We have made a right decission, feel like home.”
Reviews.Author: sonorsotha
Reviews.Content: After we have searched for a lot of hotel in Sultanahmet area, we have read almost all comments in each hotel and finally we selected this hotel only from their high rating and reasonable price for us. We were impressed by their hospitality and helpfulness from Ibrahim (the owner) and his staff which you can asked for their help 24 hours a day. The location was within 5 minutes from Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia but in the quiet part of the area. The room we have was clean and airy. The roof top breakfast was breezy with Mamara sea view. We will be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Robert5480
Reviews.Content: Quaint 12 room boutique hotel centrally located on a quiet street in the historical Sultanahmet district. My wife and I stayed in a standard room, which though small, was clean and comfortable and a suitable base for exploring Istanbul. There is no restaurant in the hotel but they do have breakfast on the roof top with an incredible view of the Blue Mosque. The staff at the front desk could not have been more helpful, especially Ibrahim, the general manager. He made great restaurant recommendations and arranged transportation, guides and of course, a Turkish bath. Once he found out we were there to celebrate our anniversary, he made sure that the restaurant (only 5 minutes walk) set aside a special table by the fireplace; and upon our return had a bottle of wine and fruit in our room. Such personal attention added to a wonderful stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Promising little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Serkore
Reviews.Content: The young manager took charge of the place a couple of months ago and has already improved things. The new terrace on the roof has a view onto the Blue Mosque. While I was there, a kitchen and bar were being built onto the terrace which means farewell to the horrible, fake orange juice and average breakfast and hello to fresh products and food. The rooms are a bit kitsch but I prefer that to cold Heathrow Ibis hotel efficiency. A very promising place with a dynamic manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EnglandSmarties
Reviews.Content: We spent a very enjoyable 4 nights at the Apex Hotel. The location is excellant and the staff friendly and very helpful.
