The room we had (we were given a choice of 2) was larger than average, with a very comfy bed and a good sized bathroom. Shower was good with plentiful supply of hot water, but some of the other fttings need a little TLC. Toilet roll holder only held in place by one screw, so roll kept falling on to the floor. Hairdryer kept falling out of holder and glass shelf above basin broken at one end. Only small things, but annoying! Breakfast was ok, bread, cold meats, cheese, boiled eggs, jams, fruit etc. Coffee and orange juice could be improved. Basically, the hotel was as described on the Internet and good value for the centre of the Old Town. A little quiet haven after the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt be better:)”
Reviews.Author: FTurkan
Reviews.Content: It may not be the best hotel of stars but i may say that it is the best place that we could stay and the only place we ll stay in the future. Perfect location (walking distance to historical places-sultanahmet-topkapi palace-yerebatan-ayasofya and many more)the friendliest ever and helpfull staff, it was a home away from home... we love u guys and hope to see u again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Wonderful Staff. Perfect! A Must!!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidPG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights and can say that it is faultless. Ibrahim and his staff pull out all the stops to ensure that you have a wonderful time and are very helpful with advice on places to eat and where to go and what to watch out for. They offer a courtesy transfer from the airport to the hotel and if you're staying six nights or more they offer a courtesy transfer back to the airport otherwise transfers cost TRY40 (approx Euro18). There's free Wi-Fi. Bedrooms and bathrooms are comfortable, very clean with fresh towels every day. Breakfast, although simple, is fresh and delicious and is included in the nights stay. The hotel is 200 meters from the Blue Mosque and within walking distance of everywhere. It's in a lovely, clean and safe location and I couldn't recommend it highly enough. We've already advised friends and family to stay here and we're really suggesting you consider the Apex. You'll enjoy it and the warm welcome. We can't thank Ibrahim and his team for their help in making our visit to Istanbul such a memorable and happy one.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Central Location”
Reviews.Author: SH88
Reviews.Content: The best part about this boutique hotel is its location -- near the main attractions and yet quiet and safe. There are several other boutique hotels along the stretch and around the neighborhood and yet, there's a casual and calm feel about the place. This is not a five-star hotel, but the friendliness of the reception staff -- Fikret, Ibrahim, and Yusof -- and the convenient location more than make up for it. The hotel has a family rather than a commercial feel to it. When I checked out, I had some leftover Turkish lira. They allowed me to pay in part in Euro and in part in lira. Because of the conversion, I didn't have the exact amount, and yet, they were so nice to close an eye about it. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “EXcellent, clean, friendly staff, close to historical places”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDubai
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean,comfortable rooms, 24hrs hotwater,sufficient spread breakfast,very friendly staff, arrange your sightseeing arrangements,value for money rates

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Agafa
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice, cozy and charming hotel directly in the heart of Historical center o the quiet street. Clean rooms decorated Cupidons, terrace with a view on Blue Mosque. Very friendly staff.We will come back to this beautiful hotel in the June!

Reviews.Title: “Very good small clean hotel, friendly staff, centrally located (5 minute walt to the Blue Mosque).”
Reviews.Author: lego52
Reviews.Content: Very good small clean hotel, friendly staff, centrally located (5 minute walt to the Blue Mosque).

Reviews.Title: “Funny hotel with angel's decoration right in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Lets_go_outside
Reviews.Content: When we were choosing the hotel, it was about 2 a.m. so it was extremely hard to find something. Finally we opened the fun photoes of Apex hotel with angels over the beds and 32-teeth smiling stuff. We decided to come here to look at them by our own eyes. So we booked the room and after this minute didn't have any regrets about our choise. Right the next day after the booking, I received the confirmation about it and a question about details of the flight to pick us up in the airport by a free transfer. Actually I liked this moment, because I don't like to call to the hotel by myself to clean up all the details. The hotel is situated on a very quiet street even if it's really located in the historical center, close to the sea also. A guest manager Yunus gave us a very good room, which we liked as soon as we entered it. It was big (for a hotel of such type), clean and comfortable for us for two weeks staying in Istanbul. Everything worked well. I must say, that the personnel is very-very friendly, always smiling. They try to do their best to make guests feel like at home. And actually they do it successfully. For example, we could come to have a breakfast in any time we liked (even if it was too late for breakfast, the cook Murat made a great omelet). They always were ready to help in choosing restaurant, in telling true prices for taxi, they found for us an extra-drawer to the room, gave any information we needed, and even they made a company in playing tavla. (Thanks to you, guys! Yunus can be a champion, when he has a luck! Ibrahim is not a brilliant player, frankly speaking, but probably after years of training he will begin to win(-; ). So many thanks to Apex hotel and to everybody in Istanbul, who made our holidays unforgetable! I enjoyed every day staying there and do recommend it to all, who goes to Istanbul for getting positive emotions!

Reviews.Title: “It is very much in the eye of the beholder”
Reviews.Author: ooDormouseoo
Reviews.Content: There have been very many positive reviews about the Apex Hotel Historical with the occasional poor review. So how can this be? I think with the Apex the impression can very much be in the eye of the beholder and how they feel at the time. I can see elements of everything that has been described, yet overall I feel that the Apex Historic is a favourable venue for a stay. Although staying as part of a business trip, I was relaxed, the weather was hot and the sights & smells of Istanbul were intriguing. In other words I was pleasantly disposed towards my surroundings. Viewed in this light the hotel was small, attractive & had an air of cosiness and intimacy. But fact â€“ many of the rooms are small, the shower /toilet in my room was very small, as indeed was my room with the double bed filling most of it. The dark colours of the decoration were, let us say different, but did that add to the mystery of Istanbul? Breakfast on the roof â€“ magical in the warm sun looking out over Istanbul, but my notes of my visit say â€˜adequate but not quite so tastyâ€™. I found the staff on reception to be helpful and accommodating, on one occasion providing us with refreshment as we sat outside engaged in a business meeting. As with a lot of the hotels in Istanbul, collection of guests from the airport is part of the â€˜dealâ€™ and this was the case with the Apex Historic when I stayed. The hotel was a nice place to return to at night but sights & experiences of Istanbul crowded out the memory so the accommodation took a little of a backstage in my thoughts. Its location is close to all the major historic sites, down a quiet backstreet where you are not pestered by people wanting you to dine at their restaurant. Nearby are one or two bars where you can sit outside drinking into the small hours. All in all very convivial surroundings. So I would venture that if you are honeymooning, taking a romantic break with a partner or conducting a â€˜liaison discreetâ€™ you will find the hotel quite charming, if you are â€˜passing thoughâ€™ a pleasant place to stay but if you are more used to the comforts and arrangements of the modern hotel then it could seem to you a little shabby and run down. As I say, with the Apex it is very much in the eye of the beholder.

Reviews.Title: “Better than 4 stars, excellent hotel i would recommend .....”
Reviews.Author: samozarif
Reviews.Content: It was first time in istanbul, my wife and i stayed at apex hotel 6 nights, we really enjoyed our stay. Stuff is friendly and always ready to help, room very clean, breakfast was excellent, airport transfer was appreciated, free wireless internet. free tea any time, decor is new, location is fantastic, the guest manager ( Ibrahim ) is extremely nice, he did his best to make us happy, our flight was 11:30pm , we had to check out 1:00pm, he gave us free room to stay and free drink. If you wanna stay in istanbul go to apex. excellent hotel i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jan051
Reviews.Content: We spent in this hotel only one weekend but it was wonderful time. The hotel is situated in the historical centre in a quiet place. You can see the Blue Mosque from the terrace just 200m from you or you can walk there in 5 minutes. I would like to stress three important points from my point of view - very friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms and no noise.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as promised”
Reviews.Author: TimoGeneva
Reviews.Content: great location, great staff and services, excellent organized pick up and drop off. we will be back to istanbul in fall and will definitely return to the apex hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Agni77
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend spent 3 nights in this hotel and I must admit that everything was perfect from the moment they picked up us from the airport (included in the price) until we left with a goodbye gift (!) from the hotel. I have never experienced such incredible service before - nicely furnished and clean room, tasty breakfasts, friendly staff always ready to help with any request. What is also important - this charming hotel is very well located in old Istanbul, just 5 minutes walk from Blue Mosque. I will come back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “the best there is!”
Reviews.Author: YvonneRobert
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights in this lovely hotel. After the excellent pick-up from the airprort , we had a very warm welcome at the hotel. We reserved a double room but they gave us a bigger room for the same price. Good service! The Staff is friendly and gives very good information and tips. Breakfast was very good, rooms, bathroom are very clean. Rooms are cleaned every day. The hotel is in a very quiet street, so no noise from the street at night and the blue mosque is just around the corner, and all the main atractions are within walking distance..,perfect. Our advice: stop searching and go to this place, you won't be disappointed. Robert & Yvonne Amsterdam, Holland

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Smappe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Apex Hotel during Christmas holidays. The shuttle service from the airport to the hotel worked well. WIFI connection was quite OK. The hotel staff was always smiling to me and willing to help - their suggestion was always useful. I loved the location too, within the walking distance, you can do the most of expected activities. The day before the departure, the hotel staff kindly offered internet checkin and printing out of boarding pass. Furthermore on the departure, I received small presents from them! Such a lovely service with perfect hospitality. I definetely recommend this hotel to the people!

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic Treat!”
Reviews.Author: sophiaDunedin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the apex for 2 very romantic nights over christmas 2008. We loved the hotel, the staff and especially the room. The hotel is close to the most important sites in the old city area and very clean and well appointed. I would happily recommend it to anybody wishing to find accomodations in Istanbul and the breakfasts are terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, great location”
Reviews.Author: SveaCH
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much our stay at the Apex Hotel. Transfer from the airport to the hotel was organised and worked very well. Had a very warm welcome up on arrival. Hotel is perfect situated. All major sights are within easy walking distance. Prefered the Sultanahmed area to Taskim, where we stayed last time. Breakfast was traditional and Ok. Good value for money! Alex/ Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Very Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkhsin38
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the apex on our first trip to istanbul. its situated ideally just a couple minutes walk from the blue mosque & aya sofia. we took advantage of the free pickup from the airport and used their services (at a charge) back to the airport as well. the hotel is modest and only has 8 rooms total - but clean with all that you need including free wireless. its not the four seasons, so don't expect those types of amenities, nor are you paying for those as the hotel is very reasonably priced. the staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful in all ways. i would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a clean and well priced accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good holidays”
Reviews.Author: AnceP
Reviews.Content: The location is close to the â€œmust see sightsâ€�. Good for single travelers, have shutle from/to airport, hamam. Good advices from very friendly and helpfull staff. I recomend this hotel for everybody who want to relax from day crowd.

Reviews.Title: “My best vacation”
Reviews.Author: AMOA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three days and were completely satisfied with everything. Very friendly staff, cleanliness, quietness, good breakfast and good location, the staff were really helpful , they guide us and informed us what is the best in istanbul. they can arrange every thing for you.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: reginee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here five days and were completely satisfied with everything. Very friendly staff, cleanliness, quietness, good breakfast and excellent location near to the most important points of interest. At the airport we were picked up and brought to the hotel with a red leather bolstered car, at the hotel we were offered a welcome drink and turkish delight and we could choose from two rooms the one we liked better. At departure we even received a little present. The people here are really very kind and generous. All in all it was a very good choice and we would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: thitherandyon
Reviews.Content: We asked for an airport pickup and were quoted a price of 25 Euros, which seemed to be in line with what we expected. When they were unable to give us the room that we expected, they comped us the airport pickup, gave us a nice gift and apologized profusely. They gave us good advice about where to dine, didn't try to steer us to a particular restaurant. They were very pleasant and accommodating. The location is great and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Over Rated / Poor Quality”
Reviews.Author: travel2008vancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Apex Historical for two night after arriving in Istanbul by Cruise Ship. The hotel is well located in the historical district and is walking distance to all of the major sights. Certainly no complaints about the location at all. The hotel itself is quite run down and is in need of attention. The furniture is the cheap and nasty and the property is not well kept. The rooms are filled with low quality furnishings painted purple. The bathrooms are small and not particularly clean. On one night it rained and the water came through the ceiling and dripped on the bed all night long. The hotel did nothing to correct this not even an apology or discount. The breakfast was terrible. Some bread, tea and cereal served on a cold and depressing roof top patio. It was not even replenished when other guests came for breakfast. Really a poor offering and almost insulting. On our last night we asked for an early morning wake up call as we had an early flight home. Good thing we woke of our own accord since the call never came and we had to wake the night manager who was sleeping on the sofa in the lounge. I booked this hotel because of all of the reviews on this website, however, please be advised it's no deal and you can do so much better. The historical area is filled with wonderful small hotels that are way better than The Apex in every way. We loved the area but only wished we had chosen one of the othe hotels to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service ,cleanliness and location”
Reviews.Author: peegeeWhiteRock
Reviews.Content: We arrived by bus from Burgas, Bulgaria in the evening and took the metro and tram to the Blue Mosque stop and walked to Apex Boutique Hotel. We were met by a very friendly staff member that gave us drinks and turkish delight. Our room was in the back on the 2nd floor, with a view of the Blue Mosque. This hotel is small and quiet, but very friendly, exceptionally clean and the location is the best, within walking distance to all sights. The beds were comfortable. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and answered many questions for us each day. Breakfast was good and filling with fresh bread and many selections of cheese, meat, and salad, juices, coffee and tea. We would recommend this hotel and definately stay here again. Canadian couple 59 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location/service/room/views”
Reviews.Author: AdeleJ
Reviews.Content: Received warmest of welcomes as we checked in after a dreadful journey! Offered valuable tourist information, maps etc Thought the shower didn't work BUT it is different to home and we had not understood its method. (Perhaps like previous reviewer). It was explained to us and the next 4 days had no problems. Room in vibrant colours was so typically what I imagined Istanbul to be like, I felt like the holiday had begun. Fantastic views from the roof terrace of the Blue Mosque in one direction and the Marmaris in the other. The location was great, 2 mins walk to choice of quiet restaurants, 1 min walk further to restaurants with music and dancing, 1 min walk further Blue Mosque, then busy restaurants noise and bustle, whatever suits you! We travel extensively and this is the first time I have wanted to share information and recommend a hotel. We were sorry to say goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Apex need renovation”
Reviews.Author: Dubai604
Reviews.Content: I requested my travel agent to book this hotel based on the reviews below, but I found my stay there was a total disappointment. I booked 2 twin rooms for my friends and i ( 4 pax), but we are only given 1 twin room and 1 double room near the reception area. My travel agent OK this arrangement without first checking with me. Both rooms were extreme small, (especially the double room ),there was barely much space to put our bags. The decoration of the rooms were hideous, too much red in the room, lack of calming effect. They properly want to go for the classical look, but end up looking like a cheap brothel. Problems with the rooms: Twin rooms *the hairdryer broken. (My friend went to sleep with wet hair) *heater was working *wire with the water heater way too short to reach the power point. *shower area dirty filled with hair. *moldy smell from the bed Double room: *light at the bed not working *air condition not working *shower was not working properly. *only 1 pair of slipper in the room, that was torn upon wearing. * noisy My friends, who was staying in the double room, was having problem sleeping. She can hear people checking out and making compliant. It seem that we were not the only one having problem with the room, a lady came down early in the morning complaining about a spoil shower. Nevertheless, the hotel still have a few good points going for them: * great location * nice courtyard * great view from the root top terrace. Unfortunately there are many hotels within the same area that share the same advantages, you will get better value for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Byzantine, Konstantinopel and Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: julianeCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We have just spend 9 days at the Apex Hotel and we like to give all future travellers to Istanbul our great recommandation to choose this hotel, especially people who are avoiding big hotel chains looking all the same over the whole world. The staff is kindly and the hotel is located very near the highlights to be seeing and also near an area where local turkish people live, not mentioned in the guide-books. Yours Anne-Mette Lise and Peter JÃ¸rgensen, Copenhagen, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “One of the amazing surprise during our visit in Istanbul......”
Reviews.Author: Mili28
Reviews.Content: Me and my mam had to visit IStanbul second time and we did nt want to stay in previous hotel becouse we didnt like it. We decided to search and choose the hotel in hotels website. And We noticed Apex Hotel and our choice of Apex was only course of its location, HISTORICAL location. We did nt know what Apex is and decided just to book spontaneously. And we didnt regret that we booked it! The hotel is very beautiful. The decoration of the hotel is fantastic , the oriental style amazed us. Especially the colors. The rooms are very beautiful and well decoreted, comfortable and home like. The service is very friendly and kind! We want to say the the service of the HOtel everywhere - reception, housekeeping, restraunt is on the HIGH QUALITY!!! And if we will have chance to visit Istanbul one more time - ofcourse we will stay in APEX Hotel!!!! Thanks for nice holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful area of location and kind staff"”
Reviews.Author: filippoCaltanissetta
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is wonderful, right in the centre of Instambul in a pretty area. The hotel staff is very kind expecially with children. I really advice the hotel as one of the best accomodation I have had during my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Apex very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaraRome_Italy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Apex Hotel for one week at the end of July and I strongly recommend this hotel for the exceptional location, the kindness of the staff, the friendly atmosphere and the cleanness of the room. All interesting sites are really at walking distances, the staff and the manager are very helpful and gave us useful information. Small attentions such as the pick up at the arrival, slippers in the room, the tea /drink they always offered us give to this hotel an added value. If, in the future, I 'll have the opportunity to come back to Istanbul, I 'll return in this hotel with the impression to be hosted by friends.

Reviews.Title: “I Was Well Cared For at The Apex”
Reviews.Author: MissRich64
Reviews.Content: The Apex is a small, family-run hotel with charm and style. I was in Istanbul for eye surgery and wound up with a longer recovery than I had planned for; everyone at the Apex was wonderful to me, even running out to get food for me when I couldn't see well enough! The hotel is small, but very clean and cozy. The rooms are also not huge, but they are exceptionally clean and cared for. A classic Turkish breakfast of fresh cucumbers and tomatoes, cheeses (yummy cheeses!), breads, eggs, and so on, is served each morning on a terrace with a fantastic view of the water. The Apex staff also were really receptive to any problems I had with the hotel - my TV had some problems initially, but as soon as I asked about it, it was fixed. Hey, I'm as much a TV addict as anyone, but you're really not going to want to watch a lot of TV with the beautiful surroundings you have within a 200 yard radius of the hotel. The wireless worked flawlessly for me, both in my 3rd floor room and on the cute terrace downstairs (I loved working there, because they'd serve me tea and I could play with the hotel's mascot-kitten while working!) I'm planning another trip back within the next two months and will stay at Apex again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: RobsSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: We really had a fantastic time at the hotel. The staff are extremely friendly and will go out of their way to assist with any requirements. The location is fantastic, very close to most of the tourist spots although the morning call is something to get used to! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “such a friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlanCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Apex. really friendly and accomodating staff. will definately use the hotel whenever i'm in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mbutlin
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff. Accomodating to our travel arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Apex big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: gavismom
Reviews.Content: I hate to cast a negative review here, but my husband and I were really disappointed with the quality of the Apex Hotel, especially after reading all of its glowing reviews. Upon our arrival, we were informed that we had been given a ground floor room right next to the lobby because all others were occupied. This room was tiny (there was barely space to walk around the bed to get to the bathroom), with scant light and ventilation. The wallpaper was peeling and the towel rack in the bathroom had come loose from the wall. The wall-box AC either blasted or did not work at all. We got noise and cigarette smell from the lobby and nearby lounge. By the time we made it to breakfast, the cheese and hard-boiled eggs had been consumed and were not replaced. The staff was nice and apologetic, but we opted to move to the Sirkeci Konak Hotel, which was fabulous in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: Laralu
Reviews.Content: A charming little hotel in the middle of the ancient part of Istanbul and many of the beautiful sights are only a few minutesâ€™ walk away. The rooms are not too big but very comfortable and nicely air-conditioned. The typical Turkish breakfast at the hotel terrace (on the hotel roof) is a great experience every day because of the breathtaking views of the Sea of Marmara and the Princes Islands. Service is really friendly and they even help you to learn a few Turkish phrases to get along ;-) ... Highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay. Ozolu family”
Reviews.Author: luksis
Reviews.Content: The hotel service is simply amazing and very helpful. The staff goes out of their way to make your stay convenient and enjoyable.The location was perfect. The only thing we had to get used to was the singing call to prayer from the nearby mosque, but it was not a serious problem. We loved Istanbul and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly return”
Reviews.Author: dgener8
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days at the Apex Hotel and had a great experience there! Correspondence with the staff prior to arrival was efficiently answered. Staff was very helpful and willing to assist with all our arrangements (airport transfer, late checkout, etc). Breakfast buffet was a nice experience with the backdrop of the Blue Mosque. Rooms were exceptionally clean. The manager have us a gift of Turkish apple tea with glasses and a front desk staff member gave us free postcards of Turkey! Would definitely return again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Apex Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: turkisman
Reviews.Content: we loved our staying in Istanbul and Apex hotel was the perfect accomodation for visiting all the best attractions of the city. We appreciated a lot the free service transfer from the airport to the hotel (waiting for us notwithstanding our flight was late) and also the breakfast served on terrace in a quite atmosphere, far from the noise of the city. But what revealed really winning fro our holiday was the position of the hotel, stategic indeed: 5 minutes far from blue mosquee, hagia sophia, topkapi palace, T2 tram line.

Reviews.Title: “istanbul perfect at the apex!!!”
Reviews.Author: iako
Reviews.Content: It is incredible to stay in a place for few days and feel like home. My parents staid at the hotel and they told me it was absolutely fantastic. The location absolutely incredible!!! It was my mother's birthday and the trip was her present. The hotel arranged a rose and a cake on the date which made my mother nearly crying. I personaly asked for a rose to be found at breakfast and that I would have paid myself. It was a present from the hotel!!!! and on top of this and the free transfer from the airport my mother and her friend received a welcoming present! My parents told me it was so clean and so perfect and the people so nice that they would tell everyone looking for accomodation to go there. I personally hope to visit istanbul very soon and will definitely stay at the apex. It is difficult nowadays to find a very comfy clean place to stay run by nice people genuinely looking after you. Thanks "apex team" you made my parents (and friends) stay VERY SPECIAL ! elena

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem in Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_1975_STHLM
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Istabul at the Apex, the city in itself was lovely - but the stay at Apex really made our weekend. Rooms are nice (we stayed in 134 a fairly large room with a clean but small bathroom.) The breakfast is not much to cheer about, quite boring actually. However the staff were wonderful - they really made that extra effort in making us feel welcome and at home. Location is perfect - especially if this is your first visit to Istanbul, close range to the "must see sights". And also just a few minutes walk to the tram to take you to Beygolu (for night life). We can really recommend a stay at the Apex !!

Reviews.Title: “our romantic week together”
Reviews.Author: roundys
Reviews.Content: me and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel for 7 days and it was the best 7 days of my life the staff were very freindly and kind the breakfast was lovely and our room was always clean the staff explained to us the beautifull parts of the city i dont speak very good turkish but the comunication was very good the last night i was there the staff were very helpfull because i was ill but my girlfreind did a very perfect job of looking after me i love her to bits we really had an amazing time and in october we are thinking of staying there again because we are planning to get married i hope we get the same room :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SaurabhSangekar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very nice and comfortable boutique hotel. The staff is very freindly and hospitable. Mr. Harun Cadirci was very helpful. The location is excellent as it is away from the hustle bustle but still close to the city centre. The Blue Mosque, The Hagia Sophia, the Topakiki Palace is approx. 5-10 mins away. The Spice Market, Domalbache Palace, Bosphorous, Taksim Square, Galata Towers etc are easily accessible by Trams. The tram station is about 10 min walk from the hotel. The breakfast spread was decent. My major concern is cleanliness. The room size was decent and clean. The bathrooms were also clean. When we came back from our day trips the rooms were spic and span. The hotel perse does not serve meals but there is a fairly good choice of restuarants available within 5 mins walking diatance from the Hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find.”
Reviews.Author: LuvDCaribbean
Reviews.Content: We ended our cruise in Istanbul. Knowing that we'd have already spent a fortune, I needed to find something nice, but inexpensive. I found the Apex on Trip Advisor. What a gem this was for us. It was the best price by at least 100 euros compared to any other hotel, yet no other hotel has perfect reviews. For this price, employee friendliness, and central location - you will not do better than this place. The Apex is in the same area as the 4-Seasons resort - this is a very nice area with old, restored buildings. The streets are made from bricks. Not only are all the main attractions within 5 minutes walk, but there are shops, restaurants, and pubs right around the corner. This is a super little hotel, located in a very nice neighborhood, with everything close by. This was the only piece of our trip that I feel like "I received the best deal". It's nice to feel that way once in a while. It is not a 5-Star hotel, but it's certainly a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Raf-Freya
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Apex Hotel was just perfect. We appreciated a lot the warm welcome and nice explanation about the hotel and Istanbul in general. The rooms are lovely decorated and very clean. We stayed in a room in the back which was very quiet but I think the front rooms are also nice because the hotel is located in a very quiet street. Just around the corner there are some very nice restaurants and shops and the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi palace are only a 5 minutes walk! A pity that they were working on the roof terrace but the breakfast downstairs was also nice (French bread, cheese, salami, marmelades, honey, tea, coffee, olives, eggs,...). A special plus for this hotel is the friendliness of the staff. All of them were always very helpfull and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Four wonderful days in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: WoodsIreland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after four wonderful days in Istanbul. Our stay there was truly memorable due mainly to the hospitaly shown to us by Harun and his staff at Apex Hotel Historical. All the staff were friendly and courteous at all times. We were a group of four people, a German couple and ourselves, an Irish couple. The staff were able to converse in both english and german. Apex Hotel is ideally located -- a few minutes walk from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Basilica Cistern. We had no need for public transport or taxis. Bedrooms were very comfortable, by day 4 we actually slept through the early morning call to prayer from the Blue Mosque !!! Michael Mary Cox Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Just the Best - from the USA”
Reviews.Author: nocnurse98
Reviews.Content: We have never experienced a more pleasant and welcoming hotel stay. The staff were phenominal in meeting our needs and went above and beyond our wildest expectations in making our stay a most memorable experience. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel's location is excellent. We fell in love with Istanbul and it's people and hope to return soon. We will not even consider booking our accomodations anywhere else except here.....and my children are in complete agreement...

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul, The Blue Eye City”
Reviews.Author: ICELAND2008
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and peaceful hotel in the heart of historical area of Sultanahmet. It's amazing the way we have been welcomed in Turkey by Hotel staff: a transfer from Ataturk airport to Apex hotel on a new Mercedes offered by Mr Harun Cadirci (Hotel General Manager), a welcome drink with a taste of typical Turkish sweets at our arrival, little briefing on Istanbul best attractions with informations about distances and means of transport given by desk clerk (all guys are very good, always smiling and helpful). The rooms are well equipped, with much space between bed and bath, kept tidy.... towels changed everyday, minibar, TV... The first reason why everybody should choose Apex Hotel? Because it is 5 minutes walking from the most important beauties.... and it's situated in a very safe quarter where you can find also little restaurants and pub or handicrafts shops. Before leaving the hotel a bue eye gift will be donated wishing good luck!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Apex Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Mimar Mehmet Aga Cd Amiral Tafdil Sokak No:24 | Sultanahmet - Fatih, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
